about_the_game:
PiggyGambit is an adventure puzzle game
Contains game mechanics related to chess

The pawns that promote chess trigger their "battle". Even players who don't understand chess can easily learn it.

The game also contains a combination of gameplay such as prop use, escape, and logic control, allowing this puzzle game to retain some little fun in the gradual in-depth brain-burning logic, and gradually discover the context of this bizarre adventure.

Bring you unprecedented fun of solving puzzles by strategy~

PS: The current experience and perception of the game does not represent the final quality


This game is a game I drew on a sticky note when I was in the third grade of elementary school. As long as I draw it on the paper, I can use "observation" to find out how to clear the level. (but there was no chess part at the time)
The students describe their own way of passing the test, and I will judge whether they pass the test or not.

After becoming an office worker, it is difficult to have time to do what I want to do. After a long time, I can't find the focus of my life, so I decided to make this game into a video game.
The piggy in the game also wanted to do something, but he didn't know what to do, so he set off towards the end of this world, and finally he will realize the wish he never thought of.

In the game, players will push chess pieces to trigger a "battle". Even players who don't know chess can learn it slowly. In the game, players will play against 6 kinds of pieces in chess, and gradually transition from the action of the pieces to the battle between the pieces.

Sacrificing one's own pieces during the battle is Gambit's strength. Just like the opening of the rear wing abandoning pawns, in the later stages, players need to choose the abandoned pawns to obtain the final victory.

short_description: Embark on a puzzle-solving adventure in a strange world, avoid monsters, change terrain, and start a game with mysterious chess pieces. Learn to abandon chess pieces cleverly to win.
supported_languages: English, Simplified Chinese, Japanese, Traditional Chinese
